summary: This document is a collection of emails and reports from September-October 2019 concerning conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It includes a report from a former warden detailing poor sanitation, understaffing, and security failures, as well as internal DOJ/BOP email chains discussing the UK's inquiries for assurances in the extradition case of Sadiq/Jabir Motiwala and a timeline of Epstein's suicide. This document contains email correspondence from August to November 2019 regarding the aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody. It includes internal discussions about placing MCC staff on administrative leave, drafting public statements, and responding to inquiries from the UK about prison conditions related to an extradition case. This document is a collection of internal emails and memoranda from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York concerning the incarceration and treatment of inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054) in July-August 2019. It details administrative matters, special accommodations, medical concerns, and a request related to a UK extradition case. The communications reveal concerns about preferential treatment and document conditions in the Psych Observation unit.

events.title: Epstein's Possible Suicide Attempt
events.description: News reports indicate Jeffrey Epstein was found injured in his cell at MCC, semi-conscious with marks on his neck, in a possible suicide attempt.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York at approximately 6:33 AM. CPR was administered but he was pronounced dead at the hospital.

events.title: Baird's Court Testimony
events.description: Former Warden Baird testified in a London court regarding conditions at MCC New York during the extradition case of Sadiq Motiwala.

events.title: Epstein's Last Full Day
events.description: Epstein spent the day in attorney conference. His cellmate, Reyes Efrain, was taken to court and did not return, leaving Epstein alone in his cell.

events.title: Apparent Suicide of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at MCC NY, an event ruled an apparent suicide, triggering multiple investigations.

events.title: BOP Staff Placed on Administrative Leave
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons placed two staff members who worked in the MCC NY Special Housing Unit on administrative leave pending the investigation into Epstein's death.

events.title: Warden Reassignment
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons temporarily reassigned MCC NY Warden Lamine N'Diaye to the Northeast Regional Office and named FCI Otisville Warden James Petrucci as Acting Warden.

events.title: Maureen Baird Report Filed
events.description: Former warden Maureen Baird's report on conditions at MCC, dated August 22, 2019, was filed by defendant Jabir Motiwala in UK extradition proceedings.

events.title: UK Extradition Inquiries
events.description: The US Attorney's Office and BOP staff correspond to address follow-up requests from UK attorneys regarding prison conditions, staffing, and procedures at MCC following Epstein's death, related to the extradition of Jabir Motiwala.

events.title: Inquiry into Epstein's Preferential Treatment
events.description: An MCC staff member sends an email questioning the accuracy of special accommodations for Epstein, including meals delivered to Attorney Conference and hourly unrestrained escorts to the restroom, calling it 'clear preferential treatment.'

events.title: Broken Toilet in Psych Observation Cell
events.description: Initial email is sent noting the toilet in cell #4 of the Psych Observation area may not be working correctly and instructing staff to move Epstein to a different cell upon his return from legal proceedings.

events.title: Follow-up on Broken Toilet
events.description: The Chief Psychologist follows up, stating Epstein was left in the same cell with the broken toilet and reiterates the request to move him.

events.title: Approval for CPAP Machine Extension Cord
events.description: A memorandum from the Acting Clinical Director authorizes Epstein to have access to an electrical extension cord to plug in his CPAP machine during the evening.

events.title: Medical Complaints Addressed
events.description: An email instructs staff to see Epstein regarding his attorneys' allegations that he was not receiving cholesterol or back pain medication.

events.title: Discussion on Federal Prison Suicides
events.description: An email chain discusses a USA Today article about rising federal prison suicides prior to Epstein's death, with a staff member noting that suicides in the community have also been rising.

events.title: UK Extradition Request Follow-up
events.description: Email correspondence regarding follow-up requests from the UK concerning an extradition, specifically about obtaining a declaration for inmate Motiwala.

keyFacts: A former MCC warden reported extremely dire conditions: 'disgusting' sanitation, ineffective pest control with 'rats, mice and bugs everywhere,' severe understaffing, and racial discord among correctional officers.
The document states that following Epstein's death, MCC brought in an interim warden (J. Petrucci) and had teams of experts evaluating operations, but specific corrective measures are not detailed.
Epstein's cellmate was removed for court on August 9, 2019, and did not return, violating the BOP policy that inmates removed from suicide watch should be double-celled.

Internal emails show the UK court handling Sadiq Motiwala's extradition threatened to deny it unless the US could provide assurances that a similar incident to Epstein's suicide would not happen again or that Motiwala would not be placed in MCC.
A detailed minute-by-minute timeline of Epstein's suicide on August 10, 2019, is included, showing the response from prison staff, medical personnel, and law enforcement.
Following Epstein's death, two staff members from the MCC NY Special Housing Unit were placed on administrative leave, and Warden Lamine N'Diaye was temporarily reassigned.
James Petrucci, Warden of FCI Otisville, was named Acting Warden of MCC NY and his extensive BOP career background is detailed in the correspondence.
Internal emails discuss the urgency and timing of announcing these staff changes, noting press reports linking staffing shortages and overtime to the incident.
The death triggered inquiries from UK attorneys handling the extradition of defendant Jabir Motiwala, who cited a report by former warden Maureen Baird and news articles about MCC conditions.
BOP staff provided detailed information about psychological services, suicide prevention protocols, sanitation, pest control, and staffing in the SHU in response to the UK's questions.
Internal MCC emails from July 2019 show staff raising concerns about 'clear preferential treatment' for Jeffrey Epstein, including special meal delivery and escort protocols.
Epstein was housed in the Psych Observation unit, where there were issues with a broken toilet in his cell that staff had to be reminded to fix.
A memorandum dated July 30, 2019, authorized Epstein to have an extension cord for his CPAP machine, indicating special medical accommodations.
Epstein's attorneys alleged he was not receiving prescribed cholesterol and back pain medication, prompting an internal email to address the complaints.
A separate email thread from November 2019 discusses logistical follow-up for a UK extradition request for another inmate, Motiwala.
